references.paper_title: MedleyDB: A multitrack dataset for annotation-intensive mir research.
references.reason: This paper introduces the MedleyDB dataset, which is one of the two main datasets used in the DiffVox paper for training and evaluation.
This book provides the foundation for the compressor and expander model used in DiffVox, specifically in the 'Nonlinear Processing' chapter.
This book provides the basis for Principal Component Analysis (PCA), a statistical method used in DiffVox to analyze the distribution of effect parameters.

references.paper_title: GRAFX: An Open-Source Library for Audio Processing Graphs in PyTorch
references.reason: This paper introduces GRAFx, a similar differentiable audio effect modelling package, to which the DiffVox work is compared in regards to model architecture.
This paper is a fundamental work on artificial reverberation, and specifically the approach to FDN reverb used in DiffVox.
